entries.title: Biden speaks with Brazilian president after Bolsonaro supporters storm government buildings
entries.description: President Biden extended U.S. support to President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva of Brazil in a phone call after Bolsonaro supporters stormed government buildings.

entries.title: More than 1,000 people detained in connection with attack on Brazil's capital
entries.description: Brazilian authorities have detained an estimated 1,500 people in connection with the attack on government buildings in the country's capital Sunday by supporters of former president Jair Bolsonaro.

entries.title: With drag drawing fire in the U.S., RuPaul's DragCon U.K. is a family affair
entries.description: After a three-year pandemic hiatus, RuPaul’s DragCon U.K. — one of the world’s largest drag conferences — returned to London this past weekend.

entries.title: Brazil's govt: rioters 'will not succeed' in destroying democracy'
entries.description: Brazilian authorities vowed Monday to protect democracy and punish thousands of supporters of ex-President Jair Bolsonaro who stormed seats of power.

entries.title: Brazil’s president: Rioters who stormed capital will be punished
entries.description: Brazil’s President Lula da Silva condemned the invasion by supporters of far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro. The Congress, Supreme Court, and presidential palace faced significant damage in the riot.

entries.title: UN says ozone layer slowly healing, hole to mend by 2066
entries.description: Earth’s protective ozone layer is slowly but noticeably healing at a pace that would fully mend the hole over Antarctica in about 43 years, a new United Nations

entries.title: English resort counts down to western Europe’s first satellite launch
entries.description: An English surfing resort was counting down to the first launch of orbital satellites into space from western Europe on Monday, when Virgin Orbit’s mission

entries.title: Bolsonaro supporters' camp near Brasilia army HQ dismantled
entries.description: An informal camp established by supporters of far-right former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro in Brasilia was dismantled following violent scenes elsewhere in the city.

entries.title: Climate activists vow to defend German village threatened by coal mine expansion
entries.description: Climate change activists pledged to defend a tiny village in western Germany from being bulldozed to allow for the expansion of a nearby coal mine.

entries.title: Supporters of former Brazilian President Bolsonaro storm government buildings
entries.description: Supporters of Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro stormed the country’s Congress, presidential palace and Supreme Court following claims of election security and voter fraud made by the former leader. NBC News’ Guad Venegas has the details.

entries.title: Ukraine bolsters its defenses in the east as Russia sends waves of attacks
entries.description: Ukraine said it was strengthening its forces around Bakhmut in the eastern Donbas region and repelling constant attacks there by Russian mercenary group Wagner.

entries.title: Climate activists dig in to defend German village from coal mine
entries.description: Climate activists pledged Sunday to defend a tiny village of Luetzerath in western Germany from being bulldozed for the expansion of a nearby coal mine.

entries.title: U.N. gathering seeks billions in aid for Pakistan after devastating floods
entries.description: A United Nations conference on Monday drummed up funds and other support to help Pakistan cope with the fallout of last summer’s devastating flooding.

entries.title: Tears of joy follow easing of international travel in and out of China
entries.description: Travelers have begun streaming into mainland China after Beijing opened borders that have been all but shut since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic.

entries.title: Tesla owners in China protest against surprise price cuts they missed
entries.description: Hundreds of Tesla owners gathered at the automaker's showrooms and distribution centers in China over the weekend, demanding rebates and credit.

entries.title: Ukraine's Bakhmut holding out against Russian attacks
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said defenses were holding in Bakhmut in the Donetsk region despite coming under constant bombardment.

entries.title: 400 arrested as supporters of ex-President  Bolsonaro storm Brazil government buildings
entries.description: Chaos struck Brazil's capital Sunday when supporters of far right former President Jair Bolsonaro descended on government buildings, breached them, climbed on
